title: Eggplant Parmesan With Easy Homemade Sauce

Ingredients.3: 1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste

Ingredients.4: 1  eggplant - trimmed, peeled, and sliced 1/2-inch thick

Ingredients.13: 1 sea salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.14: 1 (8 ounce) package fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease an 8x14-inch baking dish.

Directions.2: Mix seasoned bread crumbs, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, and red pepper flakes in a shallow bowl. Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and press into bread crumb mixture to coat. Lay slices onto a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven until browned and tender, about 15 minutes. Remove eggplant and reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Directions.3: Whisk tomato paste and water in a saucepan, place over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Stir in basil, oregano, parsley, garlic, brown sugar, salt, and black pepper.

Directions.4: Place eggplant slices into the prepared baking dish, overlapping the slices. Spoon tomato sauce over eggplant and top with mozzarella cheese and 3/4 cup Parmesan cheese.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 15 minutes. If desired, broil for 1 to 2 more minutes to give cheese topping a golden color. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
